extracted_data_phrases: from receiving Sacraments by my words
condoning.question: Did I lead other Catholics away from receiving Sacraments by my words?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

extracted_data_phrases: from attending Mass , the Sacraments , or receiving spiritual guidance through my words
condoning.question: Did I discourage others from attending Mass, the Sacraments, or receiving spiritual guidance through my words?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.question: Did I condone a funeral where human remains were not properly buried?
condoning.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

condoning.question: Did I permit others to expose my child to bad influences?
condoning.description: Parents have to protect their children's well-being, guarding them from harmful elements that could damage their faith or lead them into sin.

extracted_data_phrases: in a way that was contrary to Catholic values
condoning.question: Did I permit someone's behavior to influence my child in a way that was contrary to Catholic values?
condoning.description: Parents have to protect their children's well-being, guarding them from harmful elements that could damage their faith or lead them into sin.

condoning.question: Did I give my approval to another Catholic when they chose to marry outside the Church?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

condoning.question: Did I give my approval to another Catholic's decision to marry outside of the Church through my words?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

scandal.question: Did I forgo a valid Catholic marriage through deceitful means, leading to deception of others?
scandal.description: For Catholics, marriage is sacramental and needs to occur in the Church or receive a dispensation if either people are not Catholic.

extracted_data_phrases: perhaps through your words , actions , or influence

scandal.description: Leading others to sin (also called "scandal") is sinful because it actively harms another person's soul by encouraging them away from God, making you spiritually responsible both for your own sin and for potentially damaging another's relationship with God.

scandal.question: Did you try to encourage someone else to engage in sinful behavior?

uncharity.question: Did my pursuit of personal interests lead me to neglect the needs of others?

extracted_data_phrases: as inferior or unworthy of respect

extracted_data_phrases: in a way that reflects their dignity as children of God

uncharity.question: Did I lose my patience while interacting with strangers, acquaintances, or coworkers?
uncharity.description: Losing patience with others fails to reflect God's infinite patience with us and violates Christ's command to love our neighbor, instead allowing anger and frustration to override charity and kindness.

uncharity.question: Did I fail to defend someone from being treated unfairly?
uncharity.description: This sin violates the principles of justice, charity, and our moral obligation to defend human dignity and protect our neighbors from harm when we have the ability to intervene.

uncharity.question: Did I allow someone else to be treated unjustly in any situation?

Did I permit others to be treated unfairly?

Reflect on whether your actions, or lack thereof, allowed an injustice to occur. Did you fail to act with charity towards those who were being wronged?
uncharity.description: This sin violates the principles of justice, charity, and our moral obligation to defend human dignity and protect our neighbors from harm when we have the ability to intervene.

autonomy.question: Did you take for granted the good things in your life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: such as excelling in sports , traveling , and advancing professionally , to God 's providence rather than solely to my own abilities
autonomy.question: Did I credit my successes in life, such as excelling in sports, traveling, and advancing professionally, to God's providence rather than solely to my own abilities?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: without acknowledging God 's hand in guiding me
autonomy.question: Did I attribute my success and accomplishments solely to my own efforts, without acknowledging God's hand in guiding me?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I felt envious of others' successes and secretly wished they would struggle?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: such as business accomplishments or personal achievements
envy.question: Have I secretly wished that others would lose their successes, such as business accomplishments or personal achievements?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: especially during social gatherings or in online interactions
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others with vulgar or inappropriate language, especially during social gatherings or in online interactions?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control in your conversations, speaking words that were vulgar or inappropriate to others?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control in my conversation, speaking words that were unseemly or unfitting?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
with friends at restaurants or bars
gluttony.question: Did you indulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially when socializing with friends at restaurants or bars?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in excessive or immoderate eating or drinking
gluttony.question: Did I engage in excessive or immoderate eating or drinking, especially during social gatherings, sporting events, or while traveling?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing others ' private affairs for personal enjoyment
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' private affairs for personal enjoyment, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing others ' private affairs through casual conversations
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' private affairs through casual conversations, even if what was shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: over conversation or at social gatherings
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true, over conversation or at social gatherings?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Did I allow my work to interfere with observing Sundays, when it could have been avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

extracted_data_phrases: in unnecessary business or personal activities
on Sundays , when it could have been avoided
impiety.question: Did I engage in unnecessary business or personal activities on Sundays, when it could have been avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

extracted_data_phrases: especially during disagreements with friends , family members , or acquaintances rather than seeking reconciliation
with friends , family members , or acquaintances
anger.question: Have I nursed anger in my thoughts, especially during disagreements with friends, family members, or acquaintances rather than seeking reconciliation?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
